acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours EC50=2.3mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report, 2005).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 12,180mg/kg (EHC 190 (1997)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Because the LC50 value (4 hours) of 8,977ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (6-hour inhalation) of 5,984ppm/kg (EHC 190 (1997)), exceeded the saturated vapour concentration (6,600ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.67kPa (20degC), the substance was considered as "mist exposure" and was classified based on the LC50 (4 hours) value of 39.59mg/kg.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 5,011mg/kg (EHC 190 (1997)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the description in ICSC (J) (2002): "May cause aspiration and chemical pneumonia if swallowed." Based on the fact that m-xylene is a hydrocarbon and has a dynamic viscosity of 0.676mm2/s (25degC) (CERI calculated value).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group I by EPA (2003), Category A4 by ACGIH (2001) and Category 2 by IARC (1999).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 100% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=3.2 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1307 (Xylene))

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 27degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2002) which is classified into Category 3. Classified into Class 3 and Packing Group II-III (UN#1307 (Xylene)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.62 (2004), ATSDR (1997).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; the auto-ignition temperature is 527degC (ICSC, 2002)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No. 62 (2004): Fetal death is observed at dosing levels toxic to dams.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 96-30 (ii) (1997), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No. 62 (2004)): The substance causes moderate skin irritation.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 96-30 (ii) (1997), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No. 62 (2004)): The substance causes skin irritation. Classified into Category 2 or 3, with the latter adopted according to the classification by EU (Category Xi).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "an increase in reaction time, impaired sense of equilibrium" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.62 (2004)), and the evidence from animal studies including "loss of coordination" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.62 (2004)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In epidemiological study, disturbance of the sense of balance was reported (DFGOT vol.5 (1993)). In animal experimnet, changes in posture, decreased arousal and rearing, increased ease of handling, disturbances of gait, mobility and  righting reflex, decreased forelimb grip strength, increased landing foot splay and impaired psychomotor coordination and decreased response to various sensory stimuli were reported (EHC 190 (1997)). These observations suggest that the substance has a narcotic effects. Therefore, the substance was classified as Category 3 (narcotic effects).
